nav.div: Nashoba Regional School District » COVID-19 RESOURCES » COVID-19 Food and Family Assistance

p.br:
DTA Assistance Line (877) 382-2363
The DTA Assistance Line is open from 8:15 A.M. to 4:45 P.M

span.style: font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.br:
A nutrition program that provides healthy foods, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and referrals to healthcare and other services, free of charge, to Massachusetts families who qualify.
Phone: (800) 942-1007

br.br:
Leominster Food Pantry & Community Resources
52 Mechanic St, Leominster, MA 01453
http://www.ginnyshelpinghand.org/leominster-food-pantry.html
Worcester County Food Bank: Find food locator
(508) 842-3663
https://foodbank.org/find-food/#agency-locator
Project Bread
800-645-8333 option 5
http://www.projectbread.org/news-and-events/news/covid-19-hunger-food.html
Child Nutrition Outreach Program
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1gcj-hEqLnqdpn1M6j74fKpgjdQ1F2O6XxVvwcvDkQYI/edit#gid=0
WHEAT Clinton Community Connections
272 High Street
Clinton, MA 01510
PH: 508-370-4943
Office Hours: Monday thru Friday 10am - 1pm
https://www.uwotc.org/WHEAT
Community Cafe Hours:
Currently only serving hot meals to go Monday-Friday 5:00-6:00 (You can go daily)
Community Cupboard Hours: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday 10am-1pm
Monday & Thursday Evenings 4:30 pm - 6pm (You can go once every 28 days)
Serves: Bolton, Lancaster and Stow and additional towns
Open Table of Maynard (serves Stow)
https://www.opentable.org/
Warm Hearts of Stow
A non-profit community service organization run by Stow residents for Stow residents
www.warmheartsofstow.com
